Multivalued field associated with all the other fields in the file to give details of a portfolio position. This field is only updated if the portfolio position is for an interest bearing security. In which case it is worked out from the formula;
GR.YIELD = INT.RATE + ((100 - GR.COST.PRICE) * (INT.RATE / 100))
Where; INT.RATE is the interest rate taken from the SECURITY.MASTER record for the security. GR.COST.PRICE is the gross cost price of the security position.
No input field automatically updated by T24.

This field is a multi-valued field associated with all the other fields in this file. It is only updated is the set of values associated with this particular value are for a security position otherwise this field will be blank.

If the position concerned is for a security then this field will contain the gross cost price for a single security expressed in the security currency of the security (which will be the security in the associated SECURITY.CCY field). It is calculated using the GROSS.COST.SEC.CCY field from the SECURITY.POSITION record represented by this set of values. It is calculated as follows ;

GROSS.COST = (COST.INVST * PERC.FACTOR) / (NOMINAL * MULT.FACTOR) Where COST.INVST is the value contained in the GROSS.COST.SEC.CCY field on the SECURITY.POSITION record. PERC.FACTOR is 100 if the Security price is expressed in percentage terms (found from the PRICE.TYPE record associated with the security) and 1 otherwise. MULT.FACTOR is the multiplication factor for the security (found from the PRICE.TYPE record associated with the security). NOMINAL is the closing nominal balance found from the SECURITY.POSITION record field CLOSING.BAL.NO.NOM. If the position is built from more than one SECURITY.POSITION record then the gross cost price is pro-rated.
No-input field. Automatically updated field. Updated whenever the data for the
portfolio is rebuilt.

Only updated if the portfolio position relates to a security position where the security is a Kassenobligationen security, that is a Security whose SUB.ASSET.TYPE record has the KASSENOBLIGATIONEN field set to YES.
For a DX transaction this holds the date on which the trade took place.

If this position is for an Account then this field will contain the accrual date found from ACCOUNT.ACCRUAL.
If this position is for a Fiduciary contract (FD) then this field will contain the maturity date of the FD.FOD.ORDER contract.
If this position is for a Forward Rate Agreement (FR) then this field will contain the maturity date of the FRA.DEAL contract.
If this position is a Loans and Deposits contract (LD) then this field will contain the maturity date of the LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS contract from the FIN.MAT.DATE field.
If this position is for a Money Market (MM) contract then this field will contain the maturity date of the MM.MONEY.MARKET contract.
If this position is for a Miscellaneous Deal (MD) then this field will contain the maturity date of the MD.DEAL contract.

If this position is for a Security position this field will only be updated if the security is a kassenobligationen security. In which case it will be the maturity date for the security taken from the MATURITY.DATE field on the SECURITY.MASTER record of the security at the time the security position was first updated.
This field is not updated by FOREX contracts linked to a portfolio.
For a Derivatives (DX) transaction this field hold the last possible maturity date for the contract.
If this position is a Swap contract (SW) then this field will contain the maturity date of the SWAP contract from the MATURITY.DATE field.

This field will show the total unrealised profit or loss arising from changes to the exchange rate between the reference currency of the portfolio and the currency in the SECURITY.CCY field. Hence is the two are equal then this will be null.
This field does not include any profit and loss arising from changes in the market price. The profit and loss arising from this is recorded in the TOT.UNRL.MKT field.

Multivalued field associated with all the other fields in the file to give details of a portfolio position. The contents of this field varies depending on the module that the position is for.
If the position if for an Account (AC) then this field will contain the ONLINE.ACTUAL.BAL balance from the Account record.
If the position is for a Fiduciary Contract (FD) then this field will contain the principal amount from the AMOUNT field on the underlying FD.FID.ORDER record.
If the position is for a Forward Rate Agreement (FR) then this field will contain the amount the agreement is for from the FRA.AMOUNT field on the FRA.DEAL transaction.

If the position is for a FOREX contract the this field will contain either the amount bought (AMOUNT.BOUGHT) or the amount sold (AMOUNT.SOLD) from the original FOREX record depending on whether this position represents the bought or sold side of the contract.

If the position is for a Loans and Deposits (LD) contract then this field will contain the principal amount from the AMOUNT field on the LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS record that gave rise to the position. If the position is for a loan then the amount will have a negative '-' symbol before it.

If the position is for a Money Market (MM) contract then this field will contain the principal amount from the PRINCIPAL field on the MM.MONEY.MARKET record that gave rise to the position. If the position is for a loan then the amount will have a negative '-' symbol before it.

If the position is for a Miscellaneous Deal (MD) transaction then this field will contain the principal amount from the PRINCIPAL field on the MD.DEAL record that gave rise to the position. If the position is for a loan then the amount will have a negative '-' symbol before it.

If the position is for a security position (SC) then this field will contain the number of securities settled by the position as at the current date. If the security position is short then the figure will be preceded by a '-' symbol.
For a Derivatives (DX) transaction this field holds the the number of lots that have been closed out or had option activity performed.

If the position is for a Swap contract the this field will contain either the AS.PRINCIPAL or LB.PRICIPAL from the original SWAP record depending on whether this position represents the Asset or Liability side of the contract.
No input field.
Automatically updated by the system.

If the position is for an account then this field will be populated as follows; if either CAP.DATE.DR.INT or CAP.DATE.CT.INT fields (multi-value 1) are null then it will be OPENING.DATE, if CAP.DATE.DR.INT is less than CAP.DATE.CR.INT then it will be CAP.DATE.DR.INT, otherwise it will be CAP.DATE.CR.INT. If the ACCOUNT.ACCRUAL parameter field LAST.DAY.INCLUSIVE is set to Y then 1 calendar date will be added to the date obtained by the above rules.

This field contains the currency of the asset. The amounts in the following fields are in this currency; COST.PRICE ESTIMTED.INCOME MARKET.PRICE GR.COST.PRICE ESTIMATION V.DATE.COST MARGIN.VALUE V.DT.ESTIMATION ACCRUED.INT V.DATE.MARGIN
If this position is for an Account (AC) then this field is the currency of the account
If the position is for a Fiduciary contract (FD) then this field is the currency of the FD.FID.ORDER contract from the CURRENCY field.
If the position is a Forward Rate Agreement (FR) then this field is the currency of the FRA.DEAL from the FRA.CURRENCY field.

If the position is for a Foreign Exchange (FX) contract then this field will either contain either the bought or sold currency from the FOREX contract, from either the CURRRENCY.BOUGHT or CURRENCY.SOLD fields. When a Forex contract is recorded on the T24 Portfolio management system then the bought and sold sides are recorded separately. This is because the value of the contract to the portfolio depends on the exchange rates of the individual currencies on the deal against the reference currency of the portfolio at the time of the contract and at the time of rebuilding the portfolio valuation data. The value is then the difference (i.e. revaluation using the rebate method).
If the position is a Loans and Deposits Contract (LD) then this field is the currency of the LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS transaction from the CURRENCY field.
If the position is a Money Market Contract (MM) then this field is the currency of the MM.MONEY.MARKET transaction from the CURRENCY field.
If the position is a Miscellaneous Deal Contract (MD) then this field is the currency of the MD.DEAL record from the CURRENCY field.
If the position is a security position then this field is the SECURITY.CURRENCY of the Security from the SECURITY.MASTER record for the security.
If this position is a Derivatives Position (DX) then this fields is the current of the transaction DX.TRANSACTION.

If the position is for a Swap (SW) contract then this field will contain either the AS.CURRENCY or LB.CURRENCY fields from the SWAP contract, depending on whether this position represents the Asset or Liability side of the contract.

Multivalued field associated with all the other fields in the file to give details of a portfolio position. This field contains a percentage figure equating to the yield of the position.
This figure contains different data depending on the module that gave rise to the portfolio position;
If the position has been generated from a Fiduciary contract (FD) the this field will contain the INTEREST.RATE from the FD.FID.ORDER record that gave rise to the position.
If this position has been generated from a LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS (LD) contract then this field is taken from the INTEREST.RATE field on the LOANS.AND.DEPOSIT record that gave rise to the position.
If this position has been generated from a MONEY.MARKET (MM) contract then this field is taken from the INTEREST.RATE field on the MONEY.MARKET record that gave rise to the position.

If this position has been generated from a Security Position then if the Security giving rise to the position is a share then this field will be updated from the PROCE.EARN.RATIO field on the SECURITY.SUPP record for the security. If the security is a bond then this field will be populated from the YIELD.TO.MAT field in the SECURITY.SUPP record for the bond. If the YIELD.TO.MAY figure is blank then it will calculate a yield using the Interest Rate from the SECURITY.MASTER record for the bond and the cost price for the position.

If this position has been generated from a Swap (SW) contract then this field is taken from the INTEREST.RATE field from the SWAP.BALANCES record, of the side of the SWAP transaction represented by this set of fields.

Multivalued field associated with all the other fields in the file to give details of a portfolio position. This field will contain the cost of the position. The actual calculation done for this field will depend on the type of position this set of values represents.

If the position is for a security then this figure contains the calculated cost for a single security in the security currency. It is calculated using the COST.INVST.SEC.CCY from the SECURITY.POSITION record that gave rise to this entry on the SC.POS.ASSET file. It is calculated as follows ;
COST.PRICE = (COST.INVST * PERC.FACTOR) / (NOMINAL * MULT.FACTOR)

Where COST.INVST is the value contained in the COST.INVST.SEC.CCY field on the SECURITY.POSITION record. PERC.FACTOR is 100 if the Security price is expressed in percentage terms (found from the PRICE.TYPE record associated with the security) and 1 otherwise. MULT.FACTOR is the multiplication factor for the security (found from the PRICE.TYPE record associated with the security). NOMINAL is the closing nominal balance fould from the SECURITY.POSITION record field CLOSING.BAL.NO.NOM. If the position is built from more than one SECURITY.POSITION record then the COST.PRICE is pro-rated.

If the position is for a FOREX contract then this field will contain the exchange rate of the deal (if the portfolio reference currency is one of the currencies involved in the deal) or the market or forward rate between the currency in the associated SECURITY.CCY value and the portfolio reference currency at the time of the original contract. It is retained as the cost price until the contact matures and is removed from the portfolio valuation.
If the position is for a Forward Rate Agreement then this field will contain the value in the INTEREST.RATE field of the original contract.
If the position is for an Account then this field will be blank.
If the position is for a Money Market contract or for a Loans and Deposits contract then this field will be blank.
If the position is for a Fiduciary contract then this field will be blank.
If the position is for a Miscellaneous Deal then this field will be blank.
If this position is for a Derivatives transactions then this is the price for one lot of this contract.
No input field.
Automatically generated by the system when the information for
the portfolio concerned is rebuilt.

This field is only updated if the position is for an Account. The value dated account balance (contained in the V.DATE.NOMINAL field) is taken from the ONLINE.ACTUAL.BAL field on the ACCOUNT file. The trade dated account balance (held in the NO.NOMINAL field) includes any accounting movements resulting from the Securities module except dividends and coupons that have not yet reached Ex-Div Date. This is because the Securities movements these accounting movements relate to will be included in the portfolio valuation as a trade dated security position. Thus this field contains the difference between the NO.NOMINAL and V.DATE.NOMINAL fields for an Account position.

Multivalued field associated with all the other fields in the file to give details of a portfolio position.

This field contains a Margin value for the portfolio position. If the position is a debit or a short position then this field will be equal to the associated ESTIMATION field. Otherwise this field will contain a value calculated by multiplying the ESTIMATION amount by the Margin Rate for the position.

For all positions other than Securities (SC) and Fiduciaries (FD) then the Margin Rate will come from the MARGIN.RATE field in the ASSET.BY.CATEG record for the CATEGORY of the position - if there is one - and then default to the MARGIN.RATE field on the ASSET.TYPE record the position is linked to if there is no ASSET.BY.CATEG record. If the margin rate has not been entered on either of these files a rate os 0 is used.

If the position is for a Fiduciary (FD) contract then the system will first try to find the margin rate from the ASSET.BY.CATEG file, then use the MARGIN.RATE field on the FD.FID.ORDER record before finally using the ASSET.TYPE record if a margin rate has not been set-up on either of the other files.

If the position is for a Securities (SC) contract then the system will first see if there is a MARGIN.CONTROL record connected to the SECURITY.MASTER record for the Security. If there is the margin rate will be taken from the MARGIN.CONTROL record. If there is no MARGIN.CONTROL record connected to the Security then the margin rate will be taken from the MARGIN.RATE field of the SUB.ASSET.TYPE record the position is connected to.
No input field.
Automatically updated by the system whenever the portfolio valuation data is rebuilt.

If the position is for a FRA Deal then this field represents the market rate against which the FRA Deal rate will be compared.

If the position is a Forex then this field contains the current exchange rate between the currency on this side of the FOREX contract and the reference currency of the portfolio. The reference currency of the portfolio is in the REFERENCE.CURRENCY field of the SEC.ACC.MASTER record that defines the portfolio. A FOREX contract on the T24 portfolio system is split into its two sides for portfolio valuation purposes and the currency this side is for is contained in the SECURITY.CCY field associated with this field.
If the position is a Security Position then this field contains the price of the security from the LAST.PRICE field on the SECURITY.MASTER record for the Security.
For a derivatives transaction this field holds the current market price for the contract for which the transaction is held.

Multivalued field associated with all the other fields in the file to give details of a portfolio position. This field will contain the cost of the position. The actual calculation done for this field will depend on the type of position this set of values represents.
The value of this field is calculated in a similar way to the COST.PRICE field but using value dated positions.

If the position is for a security then this figure contains the calculated cost for a single security in the security currency. It is calculated using the VALUE.DATED.COST field from the SECURITY.POSITION record that gave rise to this entry on the SC.POS.ASSET file. It is calculated as follows ;
COST.PRICE = (VD.COST * PERC.FACTOR) / (VD.NOMINAL * MULT.FACTOR)

Where VD.COST is the value contained in the VALUE.DATED.COST field on the SECURITY.POSITION record. PERC.FACTOR is 100 if the Security price is expressed in percentage terms (found from the PRICE.TYPE record associated with the security) and 1 otherwise. MULT.FACTOR is the multiplication factor for the security (found from the PRICE.TYPE record associated with the security). VD.NOMINAL is the value dated nominal balance found from the SECURITY.POSITION record field VALUE.DATED.POSN. If the position is built from more than one SECURITY.POSITION record then the COST.PRICE is pro-rated.

If the position is for a FOREX contract then this field will contain the exchange rate of the deal (if the portfolio reference currency is one of the currencies involved in the deal) or the market or forward rate between the currency in the associated SECURITY.CCY value and the portfolio reference currency at the time of the original contract. It is retained as the cost price until the contact matures and is removed from the portfolio valuation.
If the position is for a Forward Rate Agreement then this field will contain the value in the INTEREST.RATE field of the original contract.
If the position is for an Account then this field will be blank.
If the position is for a Money Market contract or for a Loans and Deposits contract then this field will be blank.
If the position is for a Fiduciary contract then this field will be blank.
If the position is for a Miscellaneous Deal then this field will be blank.
No input field.
Automatically generated by the system.

This field contains the value of the asset in the currency contained in the associated SECURITY.CCY field.

If the position is for an Account (AC) then this field will contain the ONLINE.ACTUAL.BAL balance from the Account record plus the value of any forward entries for this account generate by the Securities module for transactions that have updated the portfolio.
If the position is for a Fiduciary Contract (FD) then this field will contain the principal amount from the AMOUNT field on the underlying FD.FID.ORDER record.
If the position is for a Forward Rate Agreement (FR) then this field will contain an estimated current value of the Forward Rate Agreement calculated from the current interest rates.
If the position is for a Forex contract (FX) then this field will contain the estimated profit or loss on the side of the Forex transaction represented by this set of fields.

If the position is for a Loans and Deposits (LD) contract then this field will contain the principal amount from the AMOUNT field on the LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS record that gave rise to the position. If the position is for a loan then the amount will have a negative '-' symbol before it.
If the position is for a Money Market (MM) contract then this field will contain the principal amount from the PRINCIPAL field on the MM.MONEY.MARKET record that gave rise to the position.
If the position is for a Miscellaneous Deal (MD) then this field will always contain zero.

If the position is for a Security positin then this field will contain an estimated valued of the security position calculated using the market price in the associated MARKET.PRICE field. If the security position is short then the figure will be preceded by a '-' sign.
If the position is for a Derivatives (DX) transaction this this field hold the current contract value.
If the position is for a Swap contract (SW) then this field will contain the Net Present Value of the side of the SWAP transaction represented by this set of fields.

This field is the value dated margin value of the position. If the position is a debit or a short position then this field will be equal to the associated V.DT.ESTIMATION field. Otherwise this field will contain a value calculated by multiplying the V.DT.ESTIMATION amount by the Margin Rate for the position.

For all positions other than Securities (SC) and Fiduciaries (FD) then the Margin Rate will come from the MARGIN.RATE field in the ASSET.BY.CATEG record for the CATEGORY of the position - if there is one - and then default to the MARGIN.RATE field on the ASSET.TYPE record the position is linked to if there is no ASSET.BY.CATEG record. If the margin rate has not been entered on either of these files a rate os 0 is used.

If the position is for a Fiduciary (FD) contract then the system will first try to find the margin rate from the ASSET.BY.CATEG file, then use the MARGIN.RATE field on the FD.FID.ORDER record before finally using the ASSET.TYPE record if a margin rate has not been set-up on either of the other files.

If the position is for a Securities (SC) contract then the system will first see if there is a MARGIN.CONTROL record connected to the SECURITY.MASTER record for the Security. If there is the margin rate will be taken from the MARGIN.CONTROL record. If there is no MARGIN.CONTROL record connected to the Security then the margin rate will be taken from the MARGIN.RATE field of the SUB.ASSET.TYPE record the position is connected to.
No input field.

This field contains the amount of interest (income) that has been accrued for the position but not yet been capitalised.
If the position is for an account (AC) then this field will contain the sum of the ACCR.CR.AMOUNT, ACCR.CR2.AMOUNT, ACCR.DR.AMOUNT and ACCR.DR2.AMOUNT fields.

If the position is for a Money Market (MM) or Loans and Deposits (LD) contract then if the contract is a deposit then this field will contain the amount from the OUTS.CUR.ACC.I.PAY from the LMM.ACCOUNT.BALANCES record. If the contract is a loan then this field will contain the OUTS.ACCRUED.INT field from the LMM.ACCOUNT.BALANCES record for the contract.
If the position represents a Fiduciary contract (FD) then this field will be updated from the OTS.INTEREST field on the FD.BALANCES record for the contract.
If the position represents a FOREX (FX) contract or a Forward Rate Agreement then this field will contain 0.
This field will not be updated if the position represents a Miscellaneous Deal.
If this position is for a Security then this field represents the amount of accrued interest on the security position.

If the position is for a Swap (SW) contract then then this field will contain the amount from the field INTEREST.AMOUNT from the SWAP.BALANCES record of the side of the SWAP transaction represented by this set of fields.
